course.subject: MECH
course.name: Experiential Learning in Robotics Technologies
course.description: Experiential Learning is one of the elements in Tri-modal Educational framework; its aim is to broaden the professional interests and exposure of students by enhancing their practicum/team-based experience through initiatives different from those of traditional lectures and tutorials. This course will provide an Experiential Learning in Robotics Technologies through 1) student-initiated designing and manufacturing of a practical Powered Wheelchair for an athlete with disability; and 2) active participation in an international competition, namely Cybathlon 2016. The goal is to develop and nurture skills in problem-solving, communication, interpersonal interaction, project and time management, etc. via experiential learning. The course will initially be led by faculty and then self-directed by students with faculty retreating as coaches or advisors. Instructorâ€™s approval is required.
